Pemilihan Dewan Pengawas KPK Belum Rampung di Tangan Presiden
01 Nov 2019, 20:21 by Denisa Tristianty


Pemilihan Dewan Pengawas KPK Belum Rampung di Tangan Presiden

Jakarta, KBRN : Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) memastikan akan memilih langsung Dewan Pengawas Komisi Pemberantas Korupsi (KPK). Penyusunan Dewan Pengawas KPK langsung dari tangan presiden itu berdasarkan Undang-Undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas UU KPK.
“Ya, saat ini untuk Dewan Pengawas KPK, kami masih dalam proses mendapatkan masukan masukan untuk siapa yang nanti duduk di dalam dewan pengawas,” kata Jokowi dalam acara diskusi mingguan bersama wartawan kepresidenan di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Peraturan penunjukan Dewan Pengawas KPK dipilih langsung oleh Presiden Republik Indonesia itu berada dalam Pasal 69A UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019.
“Untuk pelantikan Dewan Pengawas KPK akan bersamaan dengan pengambilan sumpah pimpinan komisioner KPK yang baru, yaitu pada Bulan Desember (2019). Hal ini sudah tercantum di dalam peraturan peralihan yang ada, di Pasal 69A,” tegas dia.
Masih berdasarkan UU KPK terbaru, jumlah anggota Dewan Pengawas KPK adalah lima orang. Soal tugas dan wewenang Dewan Pengawas KPK, itu terdiri dari memberikan izin atau tidak memberikan izin penyadapan, penggeledahan, dan/atau penyitaan.
Jokowi hari ini juga menjawab pertanyaan terkait belum adanya penerbitan Peraturan Pemerintah Pengganti Undang-Undang (Perppu) KPK. Banyak kalangan di sisi lain juga mendesak Jokowi sebagai presiden agar menerbitkan Perppu KPK pasca-RUU KPK disahkan, pada Selasa (17/9/2019).
Jokowi mengklaim, ada alasan besar Perppu KPK belum diterbitkan pemerintah karena UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 masih dilakukan proses uji materi di Mahkamah Konstitusi (MK).
“Kami melihat bahwa sekarang ini masih ada proses uji materi di MK. Kita harus menghargai proses proses seperti itu. Jangan ada, orang yang masih berproses uji materi, kemudian langsung ditimpa dengan sebuah keputusan yang lain. Saya kira, kami tahu sopan santun dalam bertatanegaraan,”kata mantan gubernur DKI Jakarta ini.

The Election of KPK Supervisory Board Has Not Completed in the Hands of the President
Nov 01 2019, 20:21 by Denisa Tristianty


The Election of KPK Supervisory Board Has Not Completed in the Hands of the President

Jakarta, KBRN: President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) confirmed that he would directly elect the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) Supervisory Board. The preparation of the KPK Supervisory Board directly from the hands of the president was based on Law Number 19 of 2019 concerning Amendments to the KPK Law.
"Yes, at this time for the KPK Supervisory Board, we are still in the process of getting input for those who will sit on the supervisory board," Jokowi said in a weekly discussion with presidential reporters at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta, as reported by Antara News Agency on Friday. (1/11/2019).
The regulation for the appointment of the KPK Supervisory Board directly elected by the President of the Republic of Indonesia is in Article 69A of Law Number 19 of 2019.
"For the inauguration of the KPK Supervisory Board will coincide with taking the oath of leadership of the new KPK commissioners, namely in December (2019). This has already been stated in the transitional regulations, in Article 69A, "he stressed.
Still based on the latest KPK Law, the number of KPK Supervisory Board members is five. The task and authority of the KPK Supervisory Board consists of giving permission or not giving permission for wiretapping, search and / or confiscation.
Jokowi today also answered questions related to the absence of the issuance of the Government Regulation in Lieu of Law (Perppu) of the KPK. Many circles on the other hand also urged Jokowi as president to issue the KPPU Perppu after the KPK bill was passed, on Tuesday (17/9/2019).
Jokowi claimed, there was a big reason the KPPU Perppu had not been issued by the government because Law No. 19 of 2019 was still undergoing a material review process at the Constitutional Court (MK).
"We see that currently there is still a material testing process at the Constitutional Court. We must respect such processes. Do not exist, people who are still in the process of testing the material, then immediately overwritten by another decision. I think we know the manners of governance, "said the former governor of DKI Jakarta.
